1.name: Undying Rage
1.details:
Wrath gains a stack of Undying Rage each time he basic attacks an enemy (maximum 10 stacks). In addition, when Wrath falls below a certain threshold of health, he will recover a percentage of his health over a duration.

The number of stacks will affect the amount of health recovered and Wrath's other abilities.

2.name: Fearless
2.details:
Wrath leaps up and lands down in a target direction, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power) to all enemies hit and briefly slowing them.

At maximum stacks of Undying Rage, Fearless will deal more damage and knock up the enemies instead.

3.name: Asura’s Wrath
3.details:
Wrath gains a number of Undying Rage stacks and increases his attack speed for 6 seconds.

If the number of stacks are already maxed out, Wrath gains increased life steal and attack speed instead.

4.name: Shear
4.details: Wrath reaps the enemy, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power). At maximum stacks of Undying Rage, Shear will deal true damage instead.

5.name: Unforgivable
5.details:
On first cast, Wrath breaks out of any crowd control he is currently on, marks all enemy Heroes who recently damage him for a duration and gains increased movement speed towards them.

On second cast, Wrath leaps at a nearby target enemy Hero whom he has marked, dealing a percentage of the enemy's missing health as physical damage (scaling with physical power).

At maximum stacks of Undying Rage, Wrath also gains immunity to movement speed reduction.
